job_description:
• BA/BFA in Design, Art, or a related field (or equivalent experience)8+ years of creative experience in-house or agency, ideally within a design-forward, brand-driven environmentStrong portfolio demonstrating conceptual design, storytelling, and execution across mediums (digital, motion, 3D, experiential)Proficiency in creative AI tools and emerging design technologies.
• Runway, Veo3 and Midjourney experience a plusMotion/film experience strongly preferredExceptional ability to translate creative vision into visual/motion outputs that resonate with both creatives and executivesProven track record of rapid prototyping and creative problem-solving under tight timelinesAbility to work in fast-paced, high-pressure environments with shifting prioritiesThrives in ambiguous situations, working with little direction while maintaining high qualityOutstanding presentation and communication skillsStrong background in animation principles and cinematic storytelling techniquesExperience developing storyboards, scripts, and motion treatments to sell ideas before final executionKnowledge of sound design and music integration to enhance narrative impactAbility to adapt visual storytelling for different platforms and marketing initiatives Bring creative concepts to life — transforming ideas into compelling visual and experiential outputsPartner with AI lead and creative leads to rapidly prototype, animate, and visualize concepts for internal and executive presentations, videos, and pitchesDevelop storytelling that pulls concept art off the page, building immersive experiences that inspire actionAct as a bridge between creative ideation and technical execution, translating for both creative teams and business stakeholdersExperiment with and implement AI-driven tools and techniques (Runway, Midjourney, etc.
• ) to accelerate concept realizationSupport creative selling motions to executives and other stakeholders with polished, high-impact deliverablesCreate storyboards, animatics, and narrative frameworks that bring clarity and alignment to early-stage conceptsAdd motion to design across campaigns, videos, events, and product storytelling, ensuring consistency in style and toneUse animation to simplify, inspire and communicate ideas for exec audiencesCollaborate with AI Design Lead and creative leads to align visual storytelling with original concepts Life at Salesforce Our Locations Our Locations North America Europe, Middle East, and Africa Asia Pacific Latin America Our Teams Our Teams Sales Technology & Product Customer Success Corporate Roles AI Research University University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Talent Programs Talent Programs Overview Future Pathways India Return to Work Military Fellows Our Story Newsroom Blog Careers Trust Salesforce.
• Org Sustainability Investors Give us your Feedback Sitemap Legal Terms of Service Privacy Information Responsible Disclosure Trust Contact Manage Preferences You thrive at the intersection of creativity and technologyYou love turning abstract ideas into visually stunning, tangible experiencesYou work well under pressure and can adapt quickly to changing prioritiesYou take initiative and lean forward, even in moments of uncertainty University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager You’re an inspired, positive creative force who always brings fresh ideas to the tableYou have “Yes, and…” energy—pushing ideas forward rather than shutting them downYou’re a fast learner who can shift seamlessly between design, motion, and technical problem-solvingYou see constraints as creative opportunities.

• Ability to work 12-hour shifts (3 days on/4 days off and 4 days on/3 days off), progress between day and night shifts every 4 months, and adapt to different shifts and overtime as needed to support business operations.
• Maintain situational awareness to identify hazards promptly, and consistently wear required PPE (e.
• Associate degree in relevant technical fields such as Mechatronics, Electronics, or Robotics and/or 2 years of experience in maintaining manufacturing equipment, automation, and/or technical military experience.
• Ability to collaborate with team members and communicate and address preventative maintenance needs for manufacturing equipment performance, while proactively identifying and resolving safety concerns.
• 2 years of experience performing preventative maintenance and repair on manufacturing equipment, ensuring minimal downtime, and maintaining industrial equipment, automation.
• 4+ years’ experience in leading projects related to manufacturing equipment maintenance and improvement, with a focus on meeting scope, schedule, and budget requirements.
• Working and leading projects related to manufacturing equipment maintenance and improvement, with a focus on meeting scope, schedule, and budget requirements.
• 2 years of experience in using mechanical, electronic, and PC/software skills to fix and resolve manufacturing equipment issues.
